body_html:
1. I don't see TensorInfo.cuh installed in the binary install (torch.h is there, in site-packages/torch, but TensorInfo.cuh is found only in the source tree)
root@18f70a1b119f:/workspace# find / -name torch.h
/opt/pytorch/pytorch/torch/torch.h
/opt/conda/envs/pytorch-py3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/include/torch/torch.h
root@18f70a1b119f:/workspace# find / -name TensorInfo.cuh
/opt/pytorch/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/cuda/detail/TensorInfo.cuh

so a user who has only binary install and tries to compile extension using TensorInfo won't be able to do so, unless extension itself provides a copy of TensorInfo.
2. Great, should work for tensor arguments too!

so a user who has only binary install and tries to compile extension using TensorInfo won't be able to do so, unless extension itself provides a copy of TensorInfo.
2. Great, should work for tensor arguments too!
body:
1. I don't see TensorInfo.cuh installed in the binary install (torch.h is there, in site-packages/torch, but TensorInfo.cuh is found only in the source tree)
```
root@18f70a1b119f:/workspace# find / -name torch.h
/opt/pytorch/pytorch/torch/torch.h
/opt/conda/envs/pytorch-py3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/include/torch/torch.h
root@18f70a1b119f:/workspace# find / -name TensorInfo.cuh
/opt/pytorch/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/cuda/detail/TensorInfo.cuh
```
so a user who has only binary install and tries to compile extension using TensorInfo won't be able to do so, unless extension itself provides a copy of TensorInfo. 
2. Great, should work for tensor arguments too!
